question: Which committee examine the annual audit reports of the Comptroller and Auditor General of India?
explanation: It is theÂ  Public Accounts Committee which examines the annual audit reports of the Comptroller and Auditor General of India (CAG), which are laid before the Parliament by the President. The CAG has to submit three audit reports to the President of India, which are: audit report on appropriation accounts, audit report on finance accounts and audit report on public undertakings.
